episodeTitle: The Endless Crisis! Orders to Obliterate the Straw Hat Crew
description: After Moria's defeat, shadows return to their rightful owners worldwide, saving Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Robin from disintegration. However, the Straw Hats' celebration is short-lived as Bartholomew Kuma receives orders from the World Government to eliminate all witnesses on Thriller Bark to conceal Moria's defeat.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)

events.title: Sunrise Crisis on Thriller Bark
events.description: As the sun rises over Thriller Bark, the Straw Hats who lost their shadows (Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Robin) begin to disintegrate in the daylight. The crew panics, believing their victory over Moria was for nothing as their friends start to turn to ash.
events.significance: Creates dramatic tension in the immediate aftermath of Moria's defeat, showing the crew that their battle isn't truly over until the shadows are returned. This moment emphasizes the dire consequences of shadow theft.

events.title: All Shadows Return to Their Owners
events.description: Just as the shadowless Straw Hats begin to disintegrate, all the shadows stolen by Gecko Moria are released and return to their rightful owners. Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Robin's shadows return to them in the nick of time, saving them from death by sunlight.
events.significance: Marks the true conclusion of Moria's defeat - his Devil Fruit power is completely undone and all his victims are freed. This worldwide event affects hundreds or thousands of people who had their shadows stolen over the years.

events.title: Worldwide Celebration of Shadow Victims
events.description: Around the world, people celebrate as their shadows return to them. Pirates, marines, and civilians who had their shadows stolen by Moria over the years rejoice at regaining their ability to walk in daylight. The episode shows various victims including Goo (a pirate captain), Asahija (a Marine soldier), Margarita (a waitress), and her employer Egana.
events.significance: Demonstrates the far-reaching impact of Moria's defeat beyond just the Straw Hats. Shows that Moria has been stealing shadows for years from people all over the world, and his defeat frees countless victims who can now return to normal life.

quotes.text: My shadow... it's back! I can finally go outside again!
quotes.speaker: Various victims

events.title: Goo the Pirate Captain Debut
events.description: Goo, a pirate captain who had his shadow stolen by Moria two years ago, is shown celebrating with his crew as their shadows return. He had been unable to sail properly during daylight hours, forcing him to hide below deck.
events.significance: Introduces one of Moria's long-term victims and shows the lasting impact of shadow theft. Demonstrates that Moria had been building his zombie army for years by stealing shadows from pirates across the Grand Line.

quotes.text: The shadows have returned! But how? Has Moria been defeated?
quotes.speaker: Goo's crewmate

quotes.text: That's impossible! Moria fought equally with Kaidou, one of the Four Emperors!
quotes.speaker: Goo
quotes.context: Expressing disbelief that someone could defeat Moria

events.title: Margarita and Egana Debut
events.description: Margarita, a young waitress in West Blue whose shadow was used for the zombie Victoria Cindry, reunites with her reflection after ten years. Her employer Egana witnesses her joy and forgives her for previously breaking his rare plates.
events.significance: Provides a touching human moment showing how Moria's shadow theft affected ordinary civilians. Reveals that Margarita's shadow was the one used for Cindry, connecting her to Dr. Hogback's tragic backstory.

events.title: Asahija the Marine Debut
events.description: Asahija, a second-class Marine soldier whose shadow was stolen by Moria, celebrates the return of his shadow. This shows that even Marines fell victim to Moria's shadow collection.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Moria stole shadows from both pirates and Marines alike, showing his indiscriminate collection of shadows for his zombie army regardless of affiliation.

events.title: Straw Hats Celebrate Victory
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates celebrate their victory over Moria and the return of their shadows. However, Luffy remains unconscious from the damage sustained during the battle, particularly from using Gear Second and Gear Third repeatedly. Usopp worries about Luffy having to use such dangerous techniques against stronger enemies ahead.
events.significance: Shows the aftermath of the intense battle and the physical toll on Luffy. Usopp's concern foreshadows that the enemies ahead will be even more dangerous, requiring Luffy to push himself even harder.

quotes.text: Luffy keeps pushing himself so hard... What's going to happen when we face even stronger enemies?
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Expressing concern about Luffy's dangerous fighting techniques

events.title: Reference to Moria vs Kaidou
events.description: During the worldwide shadow return scenes, a pirate mentions that Gecko Moria once fought equally with Kaidou, one of the Four Emperors. This revelation establishes Moria's past strength and explains why people find it hard to believe he could be defeated.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory about Moria's past and establishes that he was once powerful enough to challenge a Yonko. This information helps contextualize how much Moria has declined and relied on his zombie army rather than his own strength.

quotes.text: That's impossible! Moria fought equally with Kaidou, one of the Four Emperors!
quotes.speaker: Goo

events.title: World Government Orders Kuma to Eliminate Witnesses
events.description: Bartholomew Kuma receives a call via Den Den Mushi from a World Government superior. The official orders Kuma to transport the defeated Moria back to Marine Headquarters and to eliminate all witnesses on Thriller Bark, including the Straw Hat Pirates. The Government fears that news of another Warlord's defeat (after Crocodile) would damage the prestige of the Seven Warlords system.
events.significance: Reveals the World Government's willingness to commit mass murder to cover up their failures. Shows the political importance of maintaining the Warlords' reputation and sets up the immediate new threat to the exhausted Straw Hats. This demonstrates the Government's ruthless pragmatism.

quotes.text: Obliterate the Straw Hats and anyone else involved on the island. No one must know about Moria's defeat.
quotes.speaker: World Government Official
quotes.context: Ordering Kuma to eliminate all witnesses

events.title: Nami Warns About Kuma's Abilities
events.description: Nami remembers Kuma's previous appearance on Thriller Bark and warns the crew about his dangerous abilities. She specifically mentions how Kuma made Perona disappear with a touch and can teleport instantly. The crew realizes they must face this powerful Warlord while still exhausted from the battle with Moria.
events.significance: Establishes the immediate danger and creates tension. Shows Nami's strategic thinking in warning the crew about Kuma's capabilities. Sets up the crew's understanding that they're facing a threat they're not prepared for in their current weakened state.

quotes.text: Kuma is dangerous! He made Perona vanish with just a touch and can teleport in the blink of an eye!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Warning the crew about Kuma's abilities

events.title: Zoro Prepares to Fight Despite Exhaustion
events.description: Despite being completely exhausted from the battle with Ryuma and Oars, Zoro readies himself to fight Bartholomew Kuma. He stands as the first line of defense for the crew, knowing they're in no condition to fight but having no other choice.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's unwavering commitment to protecting the crew even when at his physical limits. Sets up the confrontation between Zoro and Kuma that will define the climax of the Thriller Bark arc.

events.title: Kuma Removes His Gloves
events.description: Bartholomew Kuma arrives on Thriller Bark and removes his gloves, revealing the paw pads on his palms. He prepares to demonstrate the power of his Nikyu Nikyu no Mi (Paw-Paw Fruit) against the Thriller Bark survivors and the Straw Hats.
events.significance: The removal of gloves is a signal that Kuma is about to use his Devil Fruit powers seriously. This gesture creates anticipation and dread, as the crew knows they're about to face the full force of a Warlord's abilities while weakened.

events.title: Kuma Demonstrates Paw-Paw Fruit Power
events.description: Kuma uses his Nikyu Nikyu no Mi ability to launch paw-shaped shockwave blasts at the Thriller Bark victims and survivors. The attack demonstrates the devastating power of his Devil Fruit, sending people flying with massive force and creating destruction across the area.
events.significance: First major display of Kuma's offensive capabilities with his Devil Fruit. Shows the Straw Hats that they're facing a completely different level of threat compared to Moria. The beautifully animated attack establishes Kuma as a formidable opponent.

events.title: Confrontation Begins Between Kuma and Straw Hats
events.description: The episode concludes with Bartholomew Kuma declaring his intention to eliminate the Straw Hat Pirates, starting with their second-in-command, Zoro. The exhausted crew prepares for what may be their most dangerous fight yet, knowing they must protect their unconscious captain.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic final confrontation of the Thriller Bark arc. Creates dramatic tension as the crew must face a powerful Warlord while completely exhausted and with their captain unconscious. This moment tests the crew's resolve and loyalty.

quotes.text: I'll begin with your second-in-command... Roronoa Zoro.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Declaring his intention to eliminate Zoro first

quotes.text: My shadow... it's back! I can finally go outside again!
quotes.speaker: Various victims

quotes.text: That's impossible! Moria fought equally with Kaidou, one of the Four Emperors!
quotes.speaker: Goo

quotes.text: Luffy keeps pushing himself so hard... What's going to happen when we face even stronger enemies?
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Expressing concern about Luffy's dangerous fighting techniques

quotes.text: Obliterate the Straw Hats and anyone else involved on the island. No one must know about Moria's defeat.
quotes.speaker: World Government Official
quotes.context: Ordering Kuma to eliminate all witnesses

quotes.text: Kuma is dangerous! He made Perona vanish with just a touch and can teleport in the blink of an eye!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Warning the crew about Kuma's abilities

quotes.text: I'll begin with your second-in-command... Roronoa Zoro.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Declaring his intention to eliminate Zoro first

themes.description: The episode explores how victory can be short-lived, as the Straw Hats barely have time to celebrate defeating Moria before facing a new, even greater threat. The joy of the shadows returning is immediately overshadowed by Kuma's arrival.
themes.symbolism: The sunrise that nearly kills the shadowless crew members also symbolizes a new beginning and hope, only to reveal new dangers waiting in the light.

themes.description: The worldwide return of shadows demonstrates how one person's defeat can affect countless lives across the world. Moria's shadow collection had created suffering for years, and his defeat brings relief to victims everywhere.
themes.symbolism: The shadows returning represents liberation from oppression and the restoration of normalcy to those who suffered under Moria's tyranny.

themes.description: The World Government's order to massacre all witnesses to hide Moria's defeat reveals their willingness to commit atrocities to maintain their image of power. They prioritize the appearance of strength over justice or human life.
themes.symbolism: Kuma being ordered to eliminate witnesses while still being called a 'government ally' highlights the moral bankruptcy of the system.

themes.description: Despite being exhausted, Zoro and the crew prepare to protect their unconscious captain at any cost. The episode sets up the ultimate test of crew loyalty that will culminate in the famous 'Nothing Happened' moment.
themes.symbolism: Zoro standing ready to fight despite his injuries symbolizes unwavering dedication to his role as first mate and protector.

characterSpotlights.development: Kuma is portrayed as an emotionless enforcer following the World Government's brutal orders. His arrival creates immediate dread as he prepares to eliminate the exhausted crew, setting up his complex role in the arc's conclusion.
keyActions: Receives orders from the World Government to eliminate all witnesses
Arrives on Thriller Bark with clear intent to kill
Removes his gloves to reveal his paw pads
Declares his intention to start with Zoro
quotes: I'll begin with your second-in-command... Roronoa Zoro.

characterSpotlights.role: Crew protector and first line of defense
characterSpotlights.development: Zoro shows his unwavering commitment to the crew by preparing to fight despite complete exhaustion. This episode sets up his ultimate sacrifice in the following episodes.
keyActions: Prepares to fight Kuma despite being exhausted
Stands as the crew's first line of defense
Recognizes the danger but refuses to back down

characterSpotlights.role: Strategic advisor and voice of reason
characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her strategic value by remembering and warning the crew about Kuma's abilities, helping them understand the danger they face.
keyActions: Recalls Kuma's previous appearance and abilities
Warns the crew about Kuma's teleportation and touch-based powers
Helps the crew understand the threat level
quotes: Kuma is dangerous! He made Perona vanish with just a touch and can teleport in the blink of an eye!

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp shows genuine concern for Luffy's wellbeing and worries about the future, demonstrating growth in understanding the dangers that lie ahead.
keyActions: Expresses concern about facing stronger enemies
Shows awareness of the escalating threats
quotes: Luffy keeps pushing himself so hard... What's going to happen when we face even stronger enemies?

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the worldwide shadow return scenes, showing more victims celebrating across different locations compared to the manga's briefer treatment.
The anime added more dramatic build-up to Kuma's arrival and his paw attack demonstration, with extended animation of the shockwave effects.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 483 of the manga, titled 'The End of The Dream', covering pages 2-19.
The opening theme 'We Are! (2008 Remix)' by Tohoshinki was commissioned to celebrate the anime's 10th anniversary and ran from episodes 373-394.

sources.title: We Are!/Tohoshinki (2008) Remix - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode aired on October 19, 2008 in Japan but didn't reach US audiences via Toonami until January 14, 2017, over 8 years later.
The episode features four character debuts: Goo (pirate captain), Asahija (Marine soldier), Margarita (waitress), and Egana (her employer), all victims whose shadows were stolen by Moria.
Margarita's shadow was the one used for Victoria Cindry's zombie body, revealed through this episode's connection to earlier Thriller Bark events.
This is the first episode to explicitly mention that Gecko Moria once fought equally with Kaidou, one of the Four Emperors, establishing Moria's past strength.
The One Piece anime stopped having ending songs from episode 279 to episode 1070, so this episode has no ending theme, only an extended opening.

sources.title: Why did the anime stop having ending songs since episode 279?
